{
  "Q": "What is the primary sector of many economies that provides food, raw materials, and employment opportunities?",
  "A": "Agriculture is the primary sector of many economies that provides food, raw materials, and employment opportunities.",
  "Q": "What activities are included in agriculture?",
  "A": "Agriculture includes crop cultivation, animal husbandry, fisheries, and forestry.",
  "Q": "How has modern agriculture improved productivity?",
  "A": "Modern agriculture has improved productivity through precision farming, genetically modified crops, and sustainable irrigation techniques.",
  "Q": "Why is soil health important in agriculture?",
  "A": "Soil health is crucial for maintaining agricultural productivity by providing essential nutrients to crops.",
  "Q": "What methods are used to maintain soil fertility?",
  "A": "Farmers use fertilizers, crop rotation, and organic farming techniques to maintain soil fertility.",
  "Q": "How does water management contribute to agriculture?",
  "A": "Irrigation and rainwater harvesting ensure consistent crop yields, especially in drought-prone areas.",
  "Q": "What are the major challenges faced in agriculture?",
  "A": "Major challenges in agriculture include pests, diseases, climate change, and unpredictable weather patterns.",
  "Q": "How do farmers protect crops from pests?",
  "A": "Farmers use pesticides, biological control methods, and integrated pest management strategies to protect crops.",
  "Q": "How does climate change impact agriculture?",
  "A": "Climate change impacts agriculture by causing unpredictable weather, rising temperatures, and increased occurrences of droughts and floods.",
  "Q": "How do governments support agriculture?",
  "A": "Governments support agriculture through subsidies, research funding, and policies promoting sustainable farming practices.",
  "Q": "Why are agricultural markets and supply chains important?",
  "A": "Agricultural markets and supply chains are crucial for ensuring fair prices for farmers and affordable food for consumers."
}

{
  "Q": "What does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy stand for?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy stands for Rabi Agricultural Research and Innovation for Farmers, a program by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).",
  "Q": "What is the main purpose of R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy?",
  "A": "The main purpose of R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy is to promote agricultural research and innovation for farmers.",
  "Q": "Who sponsors R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy is sponsored by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).",
  "Q": "What are the benefits of R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy for farmers?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy provides farmers with access to improved agricultural practices, technologies, and innovations that can increase productivity and sustainability.",
  "Q": "How does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy contribute to sustainable agriculture?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy contributes to sustainable agriculture by promoting research and innovation in areas such as soil health, water management, and pest management.",
  "Q": "What types of research does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy focus on?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy focuses on research in areas such as crop cultivation, animal husbandry, fisheries, and forestry.",
  "Q": "How does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy support farmers in managing pests and diseases?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy supports farmers in managing pests and diseases by promoting integrated pest management strategies and providing access to biological control methods.",
  "Q": "What role does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy play in addressing climate change impacts on agriculture?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy plays a role in addressing climate change impacts on agriculture by promoting research and innovation in areas such as drought and flood management, and developing climate-resilient crops and farming practices.",
  "Q": "How does R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy ensure that farmers receive fair prices for their produce?",
  "A": "R RABI AgRo-AdvIsoRy ensures that farmers receive fair prices for their produce by supporting agricultural markets and supply chains, and promoting policies that protect farmers' rights and interests."
}

{
  "Q1": "What has the Indian Council of Agricultural Research achieved in the development of new crop varieties?",
  "A1": "The Indian Council of Agricultural Research has developed 52 biofortified varieties and new varieties of pulses, contributing to food and nutritional security.",
  "Q2": "How did the development of new pulse varieties impact the agricultural sector during 2016-19?",
  "A2": "The availability of high-quality seeds of new pulse varieties contributed significantly to the pulses revolution during 2016-19.",
  "Q3": "What was the focus of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research in animal breed conservation and improvement?",
  "A3": "The focus was on the conservation and improvement of indigenous animal breeds, including the registration of 41 animal breeds, including poultry.",
  "Q4": "What initiatives were taken by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research towards the Blue Revolution?",
  "A4": "Induced breeding technologies were standardized, open-sea cage farming was promoted, and nutraceutical/health products from sea-weeds were developed and commercialized.",
  "Q5": "What was the significance of the Minilab for soil testing developed by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research?",
  "A5": "The Minilab for soil testing was a milestone in the area of soil health assessment, providing affordable and integrated soil testing.",
  "Q6": "What new farming system models were developed by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research?",
  "A6": "The Indian Council of Agricultural Research developed new integrated and organic farming system models.",
  "Q7": "How were the IFS models by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research upscaled?",
  "A7": "The IFS models were upscaled by state governments of Tamil Nadu and Kerala, being implemented in thousands of farmers' fields.",
  "Q8": "What measures were taken by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research to ensure high-quality higher agricultural education?",
  "A8": "The Indian Council of Agricultural Research strengthened the process of accreditation of agricultural universities/colleges and took measures to attract talented students to agricultural education and research.",
  "Q9": "What was the purpose of implementing the Fifth Deans’ Committee Report and National Higher Education Project by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research?",
  "A9": "The purpose was to generate improvements in higher agricultural education and research in India.",
  "Q10": "How did the Indian Council of Agricultural Research contribute to the conservation and improvement of indigenous animal breeds?",
  "A10": "The Indian Council of Agricultural Research registered 41 animal breeds, including poultry, and focused on the development of new vaccines and diagnosis kits for efficient management of animal diseases, increasing animal productivity."
}

{
"Q: What was the impact of ICAR's efforts on rice residue burning events in 2018 compared to 2016?",
"A: ICAR's efforts led to a 40% reduction in rice residue burning events in 2018 compared to 2016, as evidenced by remote sensing imagery.",
"Q: Which regions did ICAR focus on for difficult and remote agricultural development?",
"A: ICAR focused on Leh-Ladakh, high hills in the north-eastern region, and Andaman and Nicobar Island.",
"Q: With which organizations did ICAR sign MoUs to enhance agricultural research?",
"A: ICAR signed MoUs with DBT, CSIR, ICMR, ICFRE, IIT (D), and IMD.",
"Q: What award did ICAR receive in 2018 for its work on wheat rust diseases?",
"A: ICAR received the Global Gene Stewardship Award 2018 from the Borlaug Global Rust Initiative.",
"Q: What was the theme of the ICAR Tableau presented on 26th January 2019?",
"A: The theme of the ICAR Tableau was 'Kisan Gandhi'.",
"Q: What are some of the focus areas of ICAR's research and development?",
"A: ICAR's focus areas include food and nutritional security, pulses revolution, indigenous breeds and health management, fishery technologies, natural resources management, mechanization of field operations, higher agricultural education, lab to land and farmers outreach, interfacing and coordination with states, technology commercialization, and collaboration with national and international agencies.",
"Q: How did ICAR's coordination and collaboration with international research centres and organizations improve during the five years?",
"A: ICAR's coordination and collaboration with international research centres and organizations improved significantly, bringing visible impacts.",
"Q: What were some of the significant achievements of DARE/ICAR during 2014-19?",
"A: Significant achievements of DARE/ICAR during 2014-19 include advancements in agricultural R&D, increased efficiency, and new initiatives to meet current and future challenges.",
"Q: How did ICAR's efforts contribute to the Pulses Revolution?",
"A: ICAR's efforts contributed to the Pulses Revolution by focusing on research and development in pulses technology.",
"Q: What role did ICAR play in the Blue Revolution?",
"A: ICAR played a role in the Blue Revolution by developing fishery technologies.",
"Q: How did ICAR contribute to climate resilient agriculture?",
"A: ICAR contributed to climate resilient agriculture by focusing on natural resources management and developing technologies to adapt to climate change.",
"Q: What initiatives did ICAR undertake to enhance agricultural education and outreach?",
"A: ICAR undertook initiatives such as strengthening higher agricultural education and lab to land and farmers outreach to enhance agricultural education and outreach."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the Indian National Agricultural Research and Education Systems (NARES) known for?",
  "A1": "NARES is known for being one of the largest scientific communities in the world in terms of human resources, infrastructure, research, education, and frontline extension network.",
  "Q2": "When was the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) established?",
  "A2": "ICAR was established on 16 July 1929.",
  "Q3": "Under which ministry does ICAR operate?",
  "A3": "ICAR operates under the Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE), Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare, Government of India.",
  "Q4": "What is the primary function of ICAR?",
  "A4": "ICAR coordinates, guides, and manages research, education, and extension in agriculture and allied sectors.",
  "Q5": "How many research institutes are part of ICAR's network?",
  "A5": "ICAR's network includes 102 research institutes.",
  "Q6": "What is the role of ICAR in terms of germplasm conservation?",
  "A6": "ICAR is the custodian of a huge collection of germplasm for plants, animals, fishes, insects, and microbes for their conservation and sustainable use.",
  "Q7": "What type of advisory services does ICAR provide to the farming community?",
  "A7": "ICAR provides science-based agro-technology advisory services to the farming community.",
  "Q8": "What is the focus of ICAR's 2050 research and development areas?",
  "A8": "The focus areas include genetic potential enhancement and development of value chains of agricultural commodities, as well as agricultural productivity, input-use efficiency, and profitability.",
  "Q9": "How does ICAR support agricultural education in the country?",
  "A9": "ICAR supports agricultural education through its deemed-to-be Universities and State Agricultural Universities, following the University Grants Commission (UGC) pattern.",
  "Q10": "In what ways does ICAR support developing countries?",
  "A10": "ICAR provides techno-economic and educational support to developing countries to increase international cooperation."
}

{
"Q": "What is the significance of the Pusa Basmati 1121 variety in Indian agriculture?",
"A": "Pusa Basmati 1121, developed in 2003, now occupies about 70% of the basmati area in India and contributed Rs. 19939 crores in export earnings in 2018-19.",
"Q": "How has the HD 2967 wheat variety impacted the Indian wheat sector?",
"A": "The HD 2967 wheat variety, developed in 2011, covers about 40% of the wheat area in India and generated an economic surplus of Rs. 12,889 crores in 2018-19.",
"Q": "What are the economic benefits of the Co 0238 sugarcane variety in India?",
"A": "Co 0238, developed in 2009, achieved a sugar recovery of ~12% and covered over 80% of the sugarcane area in UP and northern States, generating an economic surplus of Rs. 10,064.3 crores in 2017-18.",
"Q": "How has the Pusa Mustard 25 variety contributed to the mustard industry in India?",
"A": "Pusa Mustard 25, released in 2010, occupied about 20% of the total mustard area in India and generated an estimated economic surplus of Rs. 14,323 crores during 2010-2018.",
"Q": "What is the economic impact of the Potato variety Kufri Pukhraj in India?",
"A": "Kufri Pukhraj, released in 1998, covers about 33% of the total potato area in India and generated an economic surplus of Rs. 4,729.0 crores in 2017-18.",
"Q": "How have the Arka Rakshak and Arka Samrat tomato hybrids impacted the tomato industry in India?",
"A": "The Arka Rakshak and Arka Samrat tomato hybrids, developed in 2010, are resistant to triple disease (leaf curl virus, bacterial wilt, and early blight), and since their release, they have accrued a total economic surplus of Rs. 237.82 crores (2018 prices).",
"Q": "What is the economic impact of the attenuated PPR vaccine in India?",
"A": "The attenuated PPR vaccine, developed in 2001, has resulted in a significant economic surplus of Rs. 9,826 crores in 2017-18.",
"Q": "How has the Jayanti Rohu variety contributed to the Indian fish industry?",
"A": "Jayanti Rohu, developed by ICAR, has an annual market value of Rs. 1313 crores and generated an economic surplus of Rs. 2547 crores during 1992-2018.",
"Q": "What are the economic benefits of using drum seeders in paddy cultivation in India?",
"A": "The adoption of drum seeders, an alternative to transplanting paddy seedlings, generated an economic surplus of Rs. 3,020 crores.",
"Q": "How has the development of new agricultural technologies and initiatives contributed to farmers' welfare in India?",
"A": "New agricultural technologies and initiatives, such as bio-security, agricultural mechanization, and the use of ICTs, have significantly contributed to farmers' welfare in India by enhancing productivity, reducing losses, and promoting sustainable farming practices."
}

{
"Q: How many experiential learning units were established in SAUs and how many students benefited from them in 2015-16?",
"A: 452 experiential learning units were established in SAUs, benefiting 69621 students.",
"Q: What was the purpose of the Emeritus Professor Scheme initiated in 2016-17?",
"A: The Emeritus Professor Scheme was initiated to harness the potentials of experienced teachers in State Agricultural Universities.",
"Q: How many slots were enhanced for the Netaji Subhash International Fellowship for overseas doctoral degree programs?",
"A: The slots for the Netaji Subhash International Fellowship were enhanced from 25 to 50.",
"Q: What was the Student-READY programme launched in 2015 focused on?",
"A: The Student-READY programme was focused on exposing undergraduate students to various facets of agri-entrepreneurship.",
"Q: How much was the student stipend under the Student-READY programme enhanced to?",
"A: The student stipend under the Student-READY programme was enhanced to Rs. 3000 per month.",
"Q: How many new pilot courses were introduced on communication skills, entrepreneurial skills, creative and innovative thinking, and leadership skills?",
"A: 65 new pilot courses were introduced on communication skills, entrepreneurial skills, creative and innovative thinking, and leadership skills.",
"Q: What was the major outcome of the H. Lab to Land and Farmers Outreach initiative?",
"A: The major outcome of the H. Lab to Land and Farmers Outreach initiative was the establishment of District Agro-Met Units (DAMUs) in 199 KVKs.",
"Q: How many units of agro-enterprises were established under the 'Attracting and Retaining Youth in Agriculture' (ARYA) program, and how many rural youth benefited from them?",
"A: 1952 units of agro-enterprises were established under the ARYA program, benefitting 4964 rural youth.",
"Q: How many mobiles apps on farm and farmers-related services were developed by ICAR between 2014-19?",
"A: ICAR developed 171 mobiles apps on farm and farmers-related services between 2014-19.",
"Q: How many mobile agro-advisories were provided by KVKs during 2014-19, and how does it compare to the period 2009-14?",
"A: KVKs provided 26.85 crore mobile agro-advisories during 2014-19, compared to 0.41 crore during 2009-14.",
"Q: How many farmers and extension personnel were trained by KVKs during 2014-19 compared to 2009-14?",
"A: KVKs trained 78.52 lakh farmers and 6.83 lakh extension personnel during 2014-19, compared to 74.76 and 5.91 lakh respectively during 2009-14.",
"Q: What was the purpose of the Technology Demonstration Component of NICRA launched by ICAR?",
"A: The Technology Demonstration Component of NICRA was launched to demonstrate exclusive climate resilient technology packages of crops and livestock production systems in vulnerable districts."
}

  "Q1": "How many centers under ICAR and SAUs were involved in the program, and how many farm families did it benefit?",

  "A3": "Cultivation of high yielding crop varieties and hybrids developed by NARS led by ICAR",

  "A4": "Malnutrition",
  "Q5": "How does malnutrition affect humans?",
  "A5": "It affects growth and development, reduces work efficiency, and has economic and societal implications",
  "Q6": "What approach has emerged as the most sustainable and cost-effective to address malnutrition?",
  "A6": "Crop biofortification",

  "A7": "29",
  "Q8": "What is the title of the booklet that published information on biofortified cultivars?",
  "A8": "Biofortified Varieties: Sustainable Way to Alleviate Malnutrition",

  "A9": "87",
  "Q10": "What nutrients have been improved in the developed and released crop cultivars by ICAR?",
  "A10": "Iron, zinc, calcium, protein, lysine, tryptophan, provitamin-A, anthocyanin, vitamin-C, oleic acid, and linoleic acid"
